DOC.brief_title: High Low Biphasic Energy Defibrillation ( HiLoBED )
DOC.detailed_description: This prospective , randomise study conduct Emergency Medicine Departments Cardiology Departments four major hospital , viz . Singapore General Hospital , National University Hospital , Changi General Hospital Tan Tock Seng Hospital . The four hospital select generally handle patient experience ventricular fibrillation ( VF ) pulseless ventricular tachycardia ( VT ) inhospital set country . The study include patient cardiac arrest , shockable rhythm ( VF pulseless VT ) age 21 year . Patients receive defibrillation pre-hospital also include still VF time arrival hospital . Patients administer one following : - Defibrillation progressive high-energy biphasic shock use Medtronic Physio-Control LifePak 12 200J , 300J 360J . If still unsuccessful , shock 360J plus anti-arrhythmics per American Heart Association ( AHA ) Singapore National Resuscitation Council ( NRC ) guideline mega VF apply . - Defibrillation low-energy biphasic shock use Medtronic Physio- Control LifePak 12 150J , 150J 150J . If still unsuccessful , shock continue high energy range ( ) plus use anti- arrhythmics per AHA NRC guideline mega VF . Results analyse obtain first/subsequent shock defibrillation efficacy post-shock myocardial function/dysfunction . This randomise study first kind explore efficacy different biphasic energy level impact myocardial integrity/function inhospital clinical setting . After completion , study expect produce least Level 2 result , would useful international resuscitation committee determine future guideline recommendation defirillation cardiac arrest victim . At conclusion study , result analyse publish soon possible . This responsibility Principal Investigator .
